title: The Oprah Magazine body copy serif face
content:
I need help in ﬁguring out which typeface the magazine, ‘The Oprah Magazine’ uses for their body content as a school project. It is a serif and I have a hunch that it is very similar to Hoefler text but customized.

If anyone knows the answer or can ﬁnd a similar typeface to it I would greatly appreciate it.

 [‹ (x) Rounded geometric sans - VAG Rounded {Jeremy Mickel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013050425/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37658 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Saint Pau Public School square sans - Agency {Ken Messenger} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013050425/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37606 "Go to next forum topic")
author: FirkaHimself

comments.content: I suggest you post a scan of said typeface. If you want us to do the effort to hunt down that typeface, the least you can do is do the effort to post a sample. If you’re lazy, we’re lazy. ;^)
BTW Identification requests should go in the Type Identification Board for... well... obvious reasons. :^)

Here are some samples of the typeface.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013050425im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/body_text_sample_6424.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013050425im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/sub_head_sample_6395.jpg)
 “Never let them see you shine”

<cite>it is very similar to Hoefler text but customized.</cite>  
Yeah, it’s [Hoefler Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013050425/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100011). Running a [search](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013050425/http:/www.google.com/search?hl=en&q=site%3Atypophile.com+Oprah+magazine&btnG=Search) first would have brought up [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013050425/http:/www.typophile.com/node/306) a lot less laborious, btw.
Thanks again. I’m new to this so everything is a learning process for me.

That’s why we’re explaining everything to you as well as we can. :^)

Welcome to Typophile, Nik, I hope you enjoy your visits.
